Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
"generally speaking" nodes farther apart will "generally" connect together more slowly and "generally" transfer data slower
imo, that's an obvious conclusion and all that this really shows
I'm not seeing any way that x ping will result in y difference (outside of the obvious above)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I'm not sure anyone understands the actual cause of that... The best mask is calculated from the recvmask, but nodes with a higher average ping have a diffrent recvmask, and are thus left out of bestmask calculations. We need adequate time for recvmask so all nodes at least nodes in good condition have time to enter the recvmask. Otherwise they are simply left out of the rotation of 640 blocks.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There is no point spending but loads of money on dedicated high speed links, when this is a software bug

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Sorry team, my details are finally on the map. They don't look great, to be expected. If ping under 1 second doesn't affect notarisations like jl has said, I'm unsure of what is causing the slow nota count. It seems with similar ping to @blackjok3r I have been getting very similar nota counts for weeks now. Which have been much lower than everyone else. I'm not saying that it proves anything, but could be evidence of what slow ping does.

Content: but the big machine is needed simple to run many coin daemons

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
Yeah I agree. My testnet machine isn't the most powerful and could be helped by upgrading. I still believe ping has played quite a big role in low nota's on average. 
On that note, unfortunately my provider in Brisbane wasn't able to service my request anymore and I have had to look around for another company. For a few reasons, and contrary to my original plan, I have had to go with a server provider out of Melbourne. As much as I wanted a node in Brisbane, I believe this still fulfills my intent of decentralizing the SH network by having a node outside of Sydney.
